basics.name: Julie Pitt
basics.label: Engineering Manager // Senior Software Engineer // Entrepreneur // Speaker
basics.summary:
WHAT is usually more significant than HOW. When building something new, I often use the "what" to shine a light on the extraneous, overly complex or mis-aligned with the goal.


Here's the tl;dr on me: 15 years combined experience building teams, scalable APIs and distributed systems; most recently co-founded startup to bring autonomous agents with "common sense" intelligence into the world; built streaming service at Netflix during initial device and international roll-outs; international speaker; Scala, Node.js, AWS and many more

work.summary:
What: Introduce autonomous agents that learn "common sense" to problems that today’s smartest machines can’t solve

How:
highlights: After a period of bootstrapping, secured seed funding from a major VC
Through research and experimentation, uncovered the limits of today's deep learning technologies in solving "common sense" problems
Developed novel IP enabling autonomous agents to learn and act in messy and dynamic environments despite ambiguity

work.summary:
What: Bring forgotten memories to life and ensure that new ones are safe and accessible

How:
highlights: Hired and led service engineering team, with emphasis on client integration, availability, fault tolerance and scale
Built AWS-deployed services and protocols in Scala
Standardized protocol and server stack to minimize design, build and release friction

work.summary:
What: Introduce people to new ideas across the web that extend beyond their immediate social bubbles.

How:
highlights: Hired a small engineering team to re-architect StumbleUpon's recommendations infrastructure in under 3 months
Built an initial proof-of-concept prototype in Scala

work.summary:
What: Connect people worldwide to movies they love.

How:
highlights: Managed a medium-sized team of engineers responsible for developing the application tier that drives Netflix streaming playback
Launched streaming service in Canada, Latin America and the UK
Rapid innovation on major streaming platforms including PS3, XBox, Wii, AppleTV, Android and iOS while maintaining quality service for hundreds of consumer electronics device models
Scaled the team from 2 to 8 engineers as server traffic increased from 500 million to 3.5 billion requests per day
Led a cross-functional effort to re-architect handling of credentials on streaming devices
Provided broad streaming domain and technical expertise to many teams

work.summary:
What: Connect people to movies they love.

How:
highlights: Developed scalable Java server application code to support explosive growth in Netflix streaming volume and device breadth
Built server functionality for first and second generation streaming app on the PS3
Integrated server DRM component and protocol enhancements for the first ever Wii console streaming app
Introduced server delivery of subtitles and alternate language tracks to Netflix streaming devices
Added 1.5 years of life to the infrastructure delivering customers’ Recently Watched activity through scalability enhancements and data store partitioning

work.summary:
What: As part of the Constellation program, bring the International Space Station up-to-date, and eventually bring humans to the Moon and to Mars.

How:
highlights: Designed and developed RDF triple store persistence API in Java
Cross-functional liason between development and ontology modeling teams
Evangelized and implemented development practices on the team, including TDD, continuous integration, use of Subversion, Hudson, Maven and Artifactory
Documented critical components on the team Confluence wiki

work.summary:
What: Support various missions ranging from follow-on research to the Human Genome Project to Biodefense in the wake of 9/11.

How:
highlights: Built Java applications to bring together disparate structured and unstructured data sources for use by scientists and analysts
Built PERL/CGI applications to process and make accessible data underpinning the Human Genome Project and beyond

volunteer.summary: Adult mentor for kids in coding club, covering topics ranging from Scratch to web development to Python
Mentor for programmers who wish to learn Scala. ScalaBridge encourages women to learn Scala and advance careers in software development.

education.area: Applied Mathematics, minor in Computer Science

publications.name: System and method for detecting active streams using a heartbeat and secure stop mechanism (patent)
Data synchronization in a storage network (patent)
